note.p: Education: School at Ingleton, Co. Durham; Peterhouse, Cambridge. BA (1679/80), MA (1684), MD (1691). Leyden (admitted 1687); incorporated at Oxford (1694)

Career: Physician in Ordinary to George I; Physician-General to the Army; active in trying to establish a dispensary where the poor could consult the best physicians, his poem 'The Dispensary' ridicules the apothecaries who fought against the idea
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; Venn; Innes Smith; Foster
References: C C Booth, 'Sir Samuel Garth, FRS: The Dispensary Poet' in NR 1985-86 vol 40 pp 125-145
Notes: Proposed by Sir Hans Sloane
